page.title: 19ARNOLD COLE TINSMITH MT.ASH
page.content:
Mr Cole is the last remaining tinsmith in South Wales.He made many of the items used by the colliers in the mine such as food boxes and'tea jacks'.Mr Cole pointed out that some of the things in our school museum had been made by him.He has now retired,and his old tinsmith workshop in Mountain Ash is now a tool shop.Sadly there will be no one to carry on this trade after Mr Cole's days.He said there is very little demand for items made of tin nowadays so nobody could earn enough money to stay in business.
Mr Cole is still asked however to give demonstrations of his craft at the National Folk Museum of Wales in St.Ffagan's near Cardiff.He has also had many magazine articles written about him and special features in various newspapers.
